items.name: Air Quality Monitoring Stations
items.description: Continuous air pollution monitoring stations within Bath & North East Somerset area. These sites provide hourly monitoring data for nitrogen dioxide or particulate matter for comparison with the Government's air quality objectives.

items.name: Smoke control areas
items.description: Areas within Bath & North East Somerset where smoke control legislation applies. Within these areas you are required to either burn approved smokeless fuels or require an appliance which has been approved by DEFRA as being smoke free. Areas declared between 1980 and 1994.

items.name: Sites of Special Scientific Interest
items.description: SSSI are the finest sites for wildlife and natural features in England, supporting many characteristic, rare and endangered species, habitats and natural features the land notified as an SSSI under the Wildlife and Countryside Act (1981).

items.name: 2011 Area Classifications
items.description: Area classifications group together geographic areas according to key characteristics common to the population in that grouping. These groupings are called clusters and are derived using census data. The area classifications are hierarchical classifications, consisting of three tiers: Supergroups, Groups and Subgroups.

items.name: Primary Shopping Frontage Policy S5
items.description: Local Plan Policy S5 adopted 2007. Primary frontages protect retail uses within the areas defined in Bath central shopping area and Keynsham, Midsomer Norton and Radstock town centres

items.name: Tree Preservation Orders
items.description: A Tree Preservation Order is an order made by a local planning authority (LPA ) to protect specific trees, groups of trees or woodlands when it is deemed to be expedient in the interests of amenity. An Order prohibits the cutting down; topping; lopping; uprooting; wilful damage or wilful destruction of trees without the local planning authority's written consent.
